action.action-desc: Mr. Hern introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Ways and Means

form.official-title: To amend title XVIII of the Social Security Act to establish a new criterion for the nonapplication of site-neutral payments to long-term care hospitals under the Medicare program.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Securing Access to Care for Seniors in Critical Condition Act of 2022.

section.header: Establishing a new criterion for the nonapplication of site-neutral payments to long-term care hospitals under the Medicare program
section.text: Section 1886(m)(6)(A) of the Social Security Act (42 U.S.C. 1395ww(m)(6)(A)) is amended—

paragraph.text: by striking or the ventilator criterion under clause (iv) and inserting , the ventilator criterion under clause (iv), or the high acuity criterion described in clause (v); and
by adding at the end the following new clause:

subclause.text: The criterion specified in this clause (in this paragraph referred to as the high acuity criterion) for a discharge from a long-term care hospital in a fiscal year is that—

item.text: the individual discharged had a primary diagnosis assigned to a Medicare-Severity-Long-Term-Care-Diagnosis-Related-Group (MS–LTC–DRG) with a relative weight for such fiscal year that was equal to or greater than the specified amount for such fiscal year; and
the discharge occurred on or after October 1, 2025.

subclause.text: For purposes of subclause (I), the term specified amount means, with respect to a fiscal year, an amount equal to the 80th percentile of the relative weights for Medicare-Severity-Long-Term-Care-Diagnosis-Related-Groups that were assigned to primary diagnoses for all discharges occurring in the preceding fiscal year.
